image.caption:
Made For: Personal
Made With: Node.js, Express.js, Javascript, HTML (handlebars), CSS
Date: Summer 2014
Overview: Developed this responsive portfolio site from scratch using Express.js

Made For: General Assembly UXD
Made With: Hype & Javascript
Date: Spring 2014
Github: Download
Overview: Fully funtional prototype of several UI enhancements to the original Labelbox mobile application. Made in Tumult Hype with embedded javscript.

Made For: JPMorgan Chase
Made With: Python, SQL Lite, XML
Date: Fall 2012 - Fall 2014
Overview: Developed various components across a securities pricing and analysitcs tool. For more details, please see my resume.

Made For: Research (UMBC)
Made With: Python, OpenSCAD and Inkscape
Date: Summer 2011
Github: Download
Overview: I developed VizTouch; a software system for blind individuals to automatically and rapidly generate tangible 3D derivatives of traditional 2D graphs. Physical prototypes were then manufactured with a 3D printer and tested for design efficacy through a series of user studies.

Made For: GWU Instructional Tech Lab
Made With: C#, XAML, Blend, Design, and Omnigraffle
Date: Spring and Fall 2011
Overview: Developed various multi touch, NUI based software applications for the Microsoft Surface. Development included a 3D campus map application based on a Bing maps control, wherein XML based building data is organized within a custom scatterview item interface and overlayed onto the map. Also wireframed and began developing a collaborative tutoring application. Code and images are witheld at the request of the Instructional Tech Lab.

Made For: Computer Graphics I
Made With: C++ and OpenGL
Date: Spring 2010
Github: Download
Overview: Final project for an introductory class on computer graphics programming. I made a simple room viewer, which incorprates object loading, navigation, collision detection, lighting, texture mapping, and two shaders (phong illumination and cell shading) implemented with GLSL.

Made For: Disaster Accountability Project
Made With: PHP and Photoshop
Date: Summer 2010
Github: Download
Overview: Simple PHP based donations thermometer showcasing front end and back end development and design.
